name: diffy-explain-ai
displayName: Diffy Commit AI - Generate Your Commit Message
description: Generate Commit Message for You or Explains The Changed Code Using Git Diff And OpenAi In Natural Language

commands.title: DIFFY: Explain Changes and Copy to Clipboard
DIFFY: Generate Commit Message and Copy to Clipboard

diffy-explain-ai.aiServiceProvider.markdownDescription:
AI service for generating commit messages.

- **vscode-lm** *(Default)*: GitHub Copilot (no API key needed)
- **openai**: Direct OpenAI API access
- **gemini**: Google Gemini API

Custom user-defined format using a template with placeholders
diffy-explain-ai.commitMessageType.markdownDescription:
Commit message format style.

- **conventional** *(Default)*: Standard format like `feat(auth): add login`
- **gitmoji**: Emoji-prefixed format like `âœ¨ feat: add dashboard`
- **custom**: User-defined template

diffy-explain-ai.maxCommitMessageLength.markdownDescription:
Maximum character length for the commit subject line:

- **50**: Strict GitHub standard (very concise)
- **72**: Common standard *(Default, recommended)*
- **100**: Relaxed limit (more descriptive)

> **Best Practice**: Keep it under 72 characters for optimal GitHub UI display.

diffy-explain-ai.includeCommitBody.markdownDescription:
Include detailed body with bullet points explaining changes.

When enabled, adds a description section below the subject line.

> **Tip**: Enable for complex changes or team code reviews.

diffy-explain-ai.additionalInstructions.markdownDescription:
Custom instructions for AI prompts.

Add team-specific guidelines, ticket references, or formatting requirements.

Leave empty for default behavior.

diffy-explain-ai.customCommitPrompt.default:
Generate a commit message for the following git diff.

Requirements:
- Maximum subject length: {maxLength} characters
- Use imperative mood
- Be concise and clear{bodyInstructions}

Return ONLY the commit message, no explanations.
diffy-explain-ai.customCommitPrompt.markdownDescription:
Custom prompt template for commit message generation.

Available placeholders: `{maxLength}`, `{bodyInstructions}`, `{locale}`, `{diff}`.

Used when Commit Message Type is set to `custom`.

diffy-explain-ai.excludeFilesFromDiff.markdownDescription:
File patterns to exclude from AI analysis.

Reduces token usage by skipping lock files, binaries, and generated files.

Supports glob patterns like `*.log`, `dist/**`, `**/*.min.js`.

diffy-explain-ai.respectGitignore.markdownDescription:
Exclude files matching `.gitignore` patterns.

Reduces token usage by automatically ignoring build artifacts and temporary files.

Works alongside Exclude Files setting.

diffy-explain-ai.enableCodebaseContext.markdownDescription:
Include project context in AI prompts for better commit messages.

Analyzes key project files to provide better scope suggestions and understand your tech stack.

> **Experimental**: Increases token usage and API costs.

diffy-explain-ai.indexedFiles.markdownDescription:
Files to analyze for codebase context.

Common examples: `package.json`, `README.md`, `tsconfig.json`, `Cargo.toml`, `go.mod`, `pom.xml`, `pyproject.toml`.

> **Tip**: Keep list focused to minimize token usage.

diffy-explain-ai.maxIndexedFileSize.markdownDescription:
Maximum file size (KB) for codebase indexing.

Larger files are skipped to control token usage.

**Range**: 10-500 KB

diffy-explain-ai.vscodeLmModel.markdownDescription:
GitHub Copilot model selection.

- **auto** *(Default)*: Automatically selects best available model
- **copilot-gpt-4o**: Latest GPT-4o (most capable)
- **copilot-gpt-4**: High reasoning capabilities
- **copilot-o1**: Advanced reasoning model
- **copilot-grok-code-fast-1**: Fast Grok model with complimentary access
- **copilot-gpt-5-mini**: Fast and reliable GPT-5 mini model

> **Note**: Requires Copilot subscription. Available models vary by tier.

diffy-explain-ai.openAiKey.markdownDescription:
Your OpenAI API key for direct API access.

**Get your key**: [OpenAI API Keys Page](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

> **Security**: Keep your API key private. Never commit it to version control.

diffy-explain-ai.model.markdownDescription:
OpenAI model selection.

- **gpt-4-turbo** *(Default)*: Fast and cost-effective
- **gpt-4**: High capability
- **gpt-4o**: Latest multimodal model
- **gpt-3.5-turbo**: Budget-friendly

[Model Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models)

diffy-explain-ai.proxyUrl.markdownDescription:
Custom proxy URL for OpenAI API requests.

Leave empty to use default OpenAI endpoint.

diffy-explain-ai.geminiApiKey.markdownDescription:
Your Google AI Studio API key for Gemini access.

**Get your key**: [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey)

> **Free Tier**: Gemini offers generous free tier quotas.

diffy-explain-ai.geminiModel.markdownDescription:
Google Gemini model selection.

- **gemini-2.0-flash-exp** *(Default)*: Latest experimental
- **gemini-1.5-pro**: High-capability
- **gemini-1.5-flash**: Fast and efficient
- **gemini-1.0-pro**: Stable production

[Model Documentation](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/gemini)

diffy-explain-ai.temperature.markdownDescription:
Controls AI response randomness.

**Range**: 0.0-2.0

- **0.0-0.3**: Focused and consistent *(recommended for commits)*
- **0.4-0.7**: Balanced creativity
- **0.8-2.0**: More creative and varied

**Default**: 0.2

diffy-explain-ai.maxTokens.markdownDescription:
Maximum commit message length in tokens.

- **196** *(Default)*: Standard commit message
- **300**: Includes commit body
- **500+**: Very detailed messages

> **Note**: Higher values increase API costs.
